If you currently live in Ukraine or Russia and feel comfortable with getting in contact with me, please DM me. I‚Äôm looking to increase the scope of my sourcing and reliability of the information I provide, especially on Russian and Ukrainian attacks. 
You will remain anonymous, and in complete control of the information you choose to provide, and how you provide it. I will only publish information that you allow me to, and that doesn‚Äôt put anyone from any side at risk. This will be extremely beneficial to my reporting. 
My telegram account: 
@AMK_Mapping1
. I also have Signal if you prefer that.

AMK Mapping

If you currently live in Ukraine or Russia and feel comfortable with getting in contact with me, please DM me. I‚Äôm looking to increase the scope of my sourcing and reliability of the information I provide, especially on Russian and Ukrainian attacks.   You‚Ä¶
¬ª

Russian forces have captured the village of Maliivka, Pokrovske Direction, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~163.
Total land area: ~1.27km¬≤.

Some general updates that I think are important to mention:
Kucheriv Yar (Dobropillya direction) remains under Russian control and has been used for new advances in multiple directions. The newest attacks have been taking place to the rear of the stronghold village of Shakhove, which Russia is trying to cut off by reaching Toretske. A strong push is also being made from Poltavka.
As for the Russian soldiers who were encircled last week, I wanted to wait a little to confirm this, but roughly 20 POWs were taken, around 15 of which surrendered near the small road north of Zolotyi Kolodyaz. The other ~5 were caught in the forests to the southeast. Everyone else was either killed or managed to escape back to the Kucheriv Yar area.
Russia has now regained the initiative in the Dobropillya direction and is making significant progress. I will post more on that later, though.

In the Bilopillya direction, Russian forces resumed their assault operations and managed to complete the capture of Bezsalivka.
After weeks of positional battles, with Ukraine holding no permanent presence in the village, Russian forces began attacking towards the western houses, which were subsequently captured. They were also able to improve their positions in the forested area to the north and secured another section of the forests along the international border.
+ ~1.13km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

Israeli defence Minister Israel Katz stated that the Knesset has approved the IDF ground operation aimed at occupying all of Gaza City. 
He stated that this operation will take place through "heavy fire, civilian evacuation, and ground maneuver," and threatened to flatten the city if Hamas doesn't accept Israel's terms, including freeing all hostages and completely disarming.
Our boy is out here doing side quests...
Our boy is out here doing side quests...

I thought it was AI generated at first 
ü§£

Major attack on Slovyansk and Kramatorsk, Donetsk Oblast just now. 
At least two Iskander-M ballistic missiles, several KAB glide-bombs and as many as 10 Geran-2 drones hit the cities, with Kramatorsk appearing to have taken the main hit. 
More KABs are flying in their direction.

Major attack on Slovyansk and Kramatorsk, Donetsk Oblast just now. 
At least two Iskander-M ballistic missiles, several KAB glide-bombs and as many as 10 Geran-2 drones hit the cities, with Kramatorsk appearing to have taken the main hit. 
More KABs are flying in their direction.
A UAV launched by the Houthis in Yemen was intercepted by the Israeli Airforce after it flew over the Egyptian border towards the Gaza envelope. Sirens sounded in multiple Israeli settlements.

Another drone from Yemen flew in from the southwest and began flying parallel with the Gaza border. Multiple interceptors were used, all of which failed to intercept it, reportedly resulting in fighter jets being scrambled. A helicopter was eventually able to shoot it down.  
As for the reports on supposed rocket launches from the Gaza Strip coinciding with the drone flight, I haven‚Äôt seen any information to suggest this actually occurred yet.

Major attack on Slovyansk and Kramatorsk, Donetsk Oblast just now.   At least two Iskander-M ballistic missiles, several KAB glide-bombs and as many as 10 Geran-2 drones hit the cities, with Kramatorsk appearing to have taken the main hit.   More KABs are‚Ä¶

Footage was published showing attacks on one of the targets from yesterday's massive attack on Kramatorsk, Donetsk Oblast.
2 MLRS rockets and 7 Geran-2 drones were used here, reportedly targeting a deployment point of two battalions of the 156th mechanised brigade of the AFU, as well as the brigade command post and warehouses storing equipment. 
Additional strikes were carried out on various other parts in and around Kramatorsk for most of the rest of the day, up until around 10pm. Over the course of the day, at least 60 KAB glide-bombs, 12 Geran-2 drones, 2 Iskander-M ballistic missiles, as well as repeated MLRS and long-range artillery strikes, targeted the area. We will likely get more footage later on.
Coordinates for the video: 48.76239, 37.48414
The Ukrainian Air Force announced that a Ukrainian MiG-29 crashed while landing, after completing a combat mission. The pilot, a 45‚Äì46-year-old, was killed.

Russian forces have captured the village of Kolodyazi, Lyman direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~340.
Total land area: ~1.40 km¬≤.

Ukrainian forces have recaptured the village of Novyi Myr, Borova direction, Kharkiv Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~81.
Total land area: ~0.52km¬≤.

In the Pokrovske direction, over the past week and a half, Russian forces have been continuing to make significant progress in Zaporizhzhia, Dnipropetrovsk, and Donetsk Oblasts.
In the south, Russian forces began assault operations in a section of the front that has remained largely quiet for years. They pushed west from the area of Levadne, and advanced down several treelines on the tactical heights, as well as down the northern bank of the Solona River in the direction of Olhivske. 
To the north, they expanded their wedge in Zaporizhzhia Oblast from Novodarivka, pushing southwest and uphill to the tactical heights, as well as west - further down the forest plantations in the low-lying ground. They also improved their positions on the tactical heights to the north, by attacking southwest from the Temyrivka - Zelene Pole road.
Further north, after capturing Temryivka, Russian forces advanced uphill and northwest towards Zaporizke, capturing new treeline positions and approaching its outskirts from two directions. They also spearheaded north along the Dnipropetrovsk side of the regional border to Novoheorhiivka, quickly establishing control over the village and forcing a Ukrainian withdrawal from the adjacent positions. 
Advances were also made between the Vorona River and a tributary of the Vorona River in Donetsk Oblast, where they were able to push downhill towards Komyshuvakha, while further improving their positions southwest and west of Shevchenko. 
In the north, Russian forces continued to bypass the rest of Maliivka from the north, moving along the heights, and capturing the agricultural buildings as well as the western part of the village, reaching the low-lying ground south of Sichneve. 
+ ~54.9km¬≤ in favour of Russia.
